meanings.definition: A unit of length equal to one ten-billionth of a meter, used especially to express wavelengths of light and distances between atoms.
meanings.sent1: Scientists use angstroms to measure the tiny distances between atoms in a molecule.
meanings.sent2: The wavelength of light is often expressed in angstroms.
meanings.sent3: I tried to measure the width of a hair using angstroms, but it was too small to see!
meanings.sent4: In the world of atoms, an angstrom is like a whisper in a crowded room.
meanings.sent5: The precision of an angstrom measurement is crucial in nanotechnology research.

meanings.definition: A unit of length equal to 0.1 nanometers, used in measuring the wavelengths of electromagnetic radiation.
meanings.sent1: The size of viruses can be described in angstroms, which are incredibly small units.
meanings.sent2: When studying X-rays, scientists often work with measurements in angstroms.
meanings.sent3: I joked that my new phone screen had pixels smaller than angstroms!
meanings.sent4: The details in the painting were so fine, they seemed to be measured in angstroms.
meanings.sent5: The precision of the telescope allowed astronomers to detect light in angstroms.
